channel.title: CyberNetSec - Latest Cybersecurity Articles
channel.description: Latest cybersecurity threat intelligence articles from the past 3 days

item.title: Oracle Issues Critical Patch for CVSS 10.0 Auth Bypass in WebLogic Server
item.description:
Oracle has released its January 2026 Critical Patch Update (CPU), a massive security release containing 337 fixes for vulnerabilities across its product portfolio. The most severe flaw addressed is CVE-2026-21962, a critical authentication bypass vulnerability in the Oracle WebLogic Server Proxy Plu...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Patch Management, Vulnerability

Read Full Article →

item.title: Everest Ransomware Claims 861GB Data Breach at McDonald's India
item.description:
The Everest ransomware group has claimed a major cyberattack against McDonald's India, alleging the theft of 861 gigabytes of sensitive data. In a post on its dark web leak site on January 20, 2026, the group threatened to publicly release the information if a ransom is not paid. The compromised dat...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach

Read Full Article →

item.title: Drones Emerge as Urgent Cyber Threat to Critical Infrastructure
item.description:
A report published on January 21, 2026, by the University of Canberra and Cisco warns of the urgent and escalating cyber threat posed by drones to critical infrastructure. The study highlights that as drone technology becomes more advanced, accessible, and affordable, its potential for use in cyber ...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Cyberattack, Threat Intelligence, Industrial Control Systems

Read Full Article →

item.title: NYDFS Enforces Stricter Cybersecurity Rules for Financial Firms
item.description:
The New York Department of Financial Services (NYDFS) has now fully implemented the final amendments to its landmark Part 500 Cybersecurity Regulation. These changes impose significantly more prescriptive and stringent requirements on regulated financial and insurance entities. As of May 2025, firms...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Regulatory, Policy and Compliance

Read Full Article →

item.title: Ingram Micro Breach Exposes Data of 42,000 After Safepay Ransomware Attack
item.description:
Global IT distributor Ingram Micro has officially notified 42,521 individuals that their personal and sensitive information, including Social Security numbers, was stolen during a ransomware attack in July 2025. The incident, attributed to the Safepay ransomware group, compromised employment and job...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Ransomware, Supply Chain Attack

Read Full Article →

item.title: CEOs Optimistic, CISOs Wary: Survey Reveals Deep Divide on AI's Cybersecurity Impact
item.description:
A new survey by specialty insurer AXIS Capital, released on January 20, 2026, reveals a significant perception gap between CEOs and CISOs regarding the role of artificial intelligence in cybersecurity. While CEOs are largely optimistic about AI's productivity and security benefits, CISOs are more ac...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Security Operations, Other

Read Full Article →

item.title: North Korean 'Konni' APT Weaponizes Google Ads to Deliver EndRAT Malware
item.description:
The North Korean state-sponsored threat group Konni is conducting a sophisticated spear-phishing campaign dubbed "Operation Poseidon." The advanced persistent threat (APT) actor is weaponizing Google advertising URLs to make malicious links appear legitimate, thereby bypassing security filters and t...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Malware, Phishing

Read Full Article →

item.title: Stealthy 'PDFSIDER' Backdoor Uses DLL Side-Loading to Bypass EDR and AV
item.description:
Security researchers at Resecurity have uncovered a new stealthy backdoor, dubbed 'PDFSIDER,' that uses a DLL side-loading technique to evade EDR and antivirus solutions. The malware masquerades as a legitimate PDF application to load a malicious DLL, establishing an encrypted command-and-control ch...

Severity: High

Categories: Malware, Ransomware, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: South Korean Giant Kyowon Group Hit by Ransomware, 9.6 Million Accounts at Risk
item.description:
The South Korean conglomerate Kyowon Group has confirmed it suffered a significant ransomware attack that disrupted operations and resulted in data exfiltration. The attack, detected on January 10, 2026, compromised approximately 600 of the company's 800 servers. South Korean authorities estimate th...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Fake Ad Blocker Crashes Chrome, Tricks Users into Installing 'ModeloRAT' Malware
item.description:
A novel malware campaign dubbed "CrashFix" is using a malicious Google Chrome extension that impersonates the 'uBlock Origin Lite' ad blocker to intentionally crash victims' browsers. The attack, attributed to a group called 'KongTuke,' then uses social engineering, presenting a fake crash report th...

Severity: High

Categories: Malware, Phishing, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: GTMaritime Launches 'GT Identify' to Tackle Maritime Cybersecurity and Compliance
item.description:
Maritime technology firm GTMaritime has launched GT Identify, a new cybersecurity system designed to help ship operators comply with increasingly stringent regulations. Announced on January 20, 2026, the system provides fleet-wide hardware and software asset inventory, vulnerability reporting, and a...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Industrial Control Systems, Patch Management

item.title: Threat Landscape Converges as Attackers Target ICS and AI Systems
item.description:
New research from Cyble highlights a dangerous convergence of threats, as both hacktivists and financially motivated cybercriminals are increasingly targeting Industrial Control Systems (ICS), Operational Technology (OT), and enterprise AI systems. The report, published January 20, 2026, notes that ...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Intelligence, Industrial Control Systems, Cyberattack

item.title: 'DragonForce' Emerges as New Ransomware Cartel Built on LockBit and Conti DNA
item.description:
A new Ransomware-as-a-Service (RaaS) operation named DragonForce has emerged, positioning itself as a "ransomware cartel." The group is reportedly building its operations on the leaked source code of the notorious LockBit 3.0 and Conti ransomware variants. Operating a RaaS platform called 'Ransombay...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Actor, Malware

Read Full Article →

item.title: Weaponized Invites: Google Gemini Flaw Allows Calendar Data Theft via Prompt Injection
item.description:
Security researchers from Miggo Security have uncovered a significant vulnerability in Google Gemini's integration with Google Calendar. The flaw allowed attackers to use an indirect prompt injection technique to exfiltrate summaries of private meetings. By sending a specially crafted calendar invit...

Severity: High

Categories: Vulnerability, Cloud Security, Data Breach

Read Full Article →

item.title: Evelyn Stealer: New Malware Hits Developers Through Malicious VS Code Extensions
item.description:
A new information-stealing malware, named Evelyn Stealer, is being distributed through malicious extensions on the Microsoft Visual Studio Code (VS Code) Marketplace. Researchers at Trend Micro and Koi Security report the campaign specifically targets software developers to steal credentials, crypto...

Severity: High

Categories: Malware, Supply Chain Attack, Threat Actor

item.title: Patch Now: Critical Flaw Exposes Thousands of TP-Link VIGI Cameras to Remote Hacking
item.description:
TP-Link has issued urgent firmware updates for a critical vulnerability in its VIGI line of security cameras. The flaw could allow an unauthenticated remote attacker to gain unauthorized access to the devices, potentially viewing, modifying, or deleting surveillance footage. At the time of disclosur...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, IoT Security, Patch Management

Read Full Article →

item.title: 16.6 Million Records Exposed: Raaga and Pass'Sport Breaches Added to Have I Been Pwned
item.description:
The Have I Been Pwned (HIBP) data breach notification service has been updated with over 16.6 million user records from two separate incidents. The first breach involves 10.2 million users of the Indian music streaming service Raaga, which occurred in December 2025 and exposed names, email addresses...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach

Read Full Article →

item.title: ScarCruft APT: North Korean Hackers Evolve Tactics in 'Artemis' Campaign
item.description:
The North Korean advanced persistent threat (APT) group ScarCruft, also known as APT37 or Reaper, has launched a new campaign dubbed 'Artemis'. Active since late 2025, the campaign targets entities likely in South Korea using malicious Hanword Word Processor (HWP) documents. Researchers report that ...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Threat Intelligence

Read Full Article →

item.title: Manhunt: Black Basta Ransomware Leader Added to EU's Most Wanted List After Raids
item.description:
An international law enforcement operation has targeted the prolific Black Basta ransomware group, which is linked to over 600 attacks and millions in ransom payments. Police in Ukraine conducted raids against two suspected members of the syndicate. Concurrently, an international arrest warrant and ...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Actor, Cyberattack

item.title: Public Exploits Released for Critical SQLi and RCE Flaws in Business Software
item.description:
Multiple critical and high-severity vulnerabilities have been disclosed in various business software products, with proof-of-concept (PoC) exploits made public, elevating the risk of immediate attack. A critical SQL injection flaw (CVE-2026-1179) affects Yonyou KSOA 9.0. A critical command injection...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Cyberattack

item.title: Access Broker Pleads Guilty After Selling Access to 50 Companies to Undercover FBI Agent
item.description:
A Jordanian national has pleaded guilty in a U.S. court for his role as an Initial Access Broker (IAB) in the cybercrime ecosystem. The man admitted to compromising and selling unauthorized access to the corporate networks of approximately 50 different enterprise organizations. The operation was unc...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Policy and Compliance

Read Full Article →

item.title: Warning: Malicious Chrome Extensions Hijack Workday, NetSuite Sessions to Bypass MFA
item.description:
Security researchers have uncovered five malicious Google Chrome extensions that impersonate legitimate add-ons for popular enterprise SaaS applications like Workday and NetSuite. The extensions are designed to perform session hijacking by stealing active session cookies and tokens after a user logs...

Severity: High

Categories: Malware, Data Breach, Cloud Security

item.title: Healthcare Data Breaches Double, Fueled by 'Shadow AI' and Vendor Risk
item.description:
The healthcare industry is facing a cybersecurity crisis, with a new report indicating that the number of data breaches doubled in the past year. The surge is being driven by two key factors: the unmanaged use of generative AI tools by staff, termed 'shadow AI,' and persistent, unmitigated risks fro...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Ransomware, Policy and Compliance

Read Full Article →
